thread.title: Seahawks activate FB Derrick Coleman, re-sign C Lemuel Jeanpierre
thread.title_full: Seahawks activate FB Derrick Coleman, re-sign C Lemuel Jeanpierre

author: STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: Seahawks activate FB Derrick Coleman, re-sign C Lemuel Jeanpierre
text:
Seahawks activate FB Derrick Coleman, re-sign C Lemuel Jeanpierre Team also waives CB Crezdon Butler, places LB Brock Coyle on IR boomerang By STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM Updated 2:57 pm, Tuesday, October 20, 2015 Photo: Elaine Thompson, Associated Press Image 1 of / 6 Close Image 1 of 6 Seattle Seahawks' Derrick Coleman sips water before an NFL football game against the Denver Broncos, Sunday, Sept. 21, 2014, in Seattle. (AP Photo/Elaine Thompson) Seattle Seahawks' Derrick Coleman sips water before an NFL football game against the Denver Broncos, Sunday, Sept. 21, 2014, in Seattle. (AP Photo/Elaine Thompson) Photo: Elaine Thompson, Associated Press Image 2 of 6 Seattle Seahawks fullback Derrick Coleman (40) is tackled by Kansas City Chiefs inside linebacker Derrick Johnson (56) during the first half of an NFL football game at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Mo., Friday, Aug. 21, 2015. (AP Photo/Ed Zurga) Seattle Seahawks fullback Derrick Coleman (40) is tackled by Kansas City Chiefs inside linebacker Derrick Johnson (56) during the first half of an NFL football game at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Mo., ... more Photo: Ed Zurga, Associated Press Image 3 of 6 Seahawks center Lemuel Jeanpierre prepares to snap the ball against the Denver Broncos during preseason action Aug. 7, 2014, at Sports Authority Field in Denver. Seahawks center Lemuel Jeanpierre prepares to snap the ball against the Denver Broncos during preseason action Aug. 7, 2014, at Sports Authority Field in Denver. Photo: Dustin Bradford, Getty Images Image 4 of 6 Seahawks center Lemuel Jeanpierre prepares to snap the ball against the Denver Broncos during preseason action Aug. 7, 2014, at Sports Authority Field in Denver. Seahawks center Lemuel Jeanpierre prepares to snap the ball against the Denver Broncos during preseason action Aug. 7, 2014, at Sports Authority Field in Denver. Photo: Dustin Bradford, Getty Images Image 5 of 6 Seattle Seahawks middle linebacker Brock Coyle (52) pumps up the crowd during the second half of the NFL football NFC Championship game against the Green Bay Packers Sunday, Jan. 18, 2015, in Seattle. Seattle Seahawks middle linebacker Brock Coyle (52) pumps up the crowd during the second half of the NFL football NFC Championship game against the Green Bay Packers Sunday, Jan. 18, 2015, in Seattle. Photo: Jeff Chiu, AP Image 6 of 6 Cornerback Crezdon Butler #26 of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in his ready stance during the first half against the Cleveland Browns at FirstEnergy Stadium on November 2, 2014. (Photo by Jason Miller/Getty Images) Cornerback Crezdon Butler #26 of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in his ready stance during the first half against the Cleveland Browns at FirstEnergy Stadium on November 2, 2014. (Photo by Jason Miller/Getty Images) Seahawks activate FB Derrick Coleman, re-sign C Lemuel Jeanpierre 1 / 6 Back to Gallery 
The Seattle Seahawks activated fullback Derrick Coleman off the reserve/suspended by club list in one of a flurry of Tuesday roster moves. 
Coleman, 25, had been suspended by the team indefinitely after he was arrested for investigation of vehicular assault and hit-and-run following a two-car crash in Bellevue on Wednesday. 
He was released from King County Jail on Friday while prosecutors decide whether or not they will press charges. That decision should come next month, after they receive toxicology results of a blood test administered after the crash. 
On Monday, head coach Pete Carroll announced the team's intentions to reinstate Coleman. It's unknown at this time if he will play in the Hawks' Thursday night matchup versus the San Francisco 49ers. 
Seattle also brought back a familiar face in free agent center Lemuel Jeanpierre, who was signed by the team on Tuesday, nearly two months after he was released by the team on Aug. 31. 
Jeanpierre, who can also play guard, should help provide the Hawks with some depth after center Patrick Lewis suffered ankle and knee injuries in his first start of the year in Sunday's 27-23 loss to the Carolina Panthers. 
The 28-year-old originally joined Seattle as an undrafted free agent out of South Carolina in 2010. He appeared in 53 games for the Seahawks from 2011 to 2014, starting 11. 
To make room for Coleman and Jeanpierre on the 53-man active roster, Seattle waived cornerback Crezdon Butler and placed linebacker Brock Coyle on the injured reserve/designated to return list. 
Coyle, 25, had appeared in the Hawks' first five games, playing almost exclusively on special teams, before missing Sunday's game versus the Panthers with a knee injury. He will be eligible to return to the active roster in Week 15. 
Butler, 28, signed with Seattle last week to provide short-term cornerback depth with Marcus Burley and Tye Smith out with injuries. Smith should return Thursday versus the 49ers, Carroll said on Monday.
